Title.Blurb: Designation of a property as a Principal Residence - Québec

Note.Blurb:
,
is the information you provided on the Federal Designation of a property as a Principal Residence the same for the Québec Designation of a property as a Principal Residence?

If the information is different on your Québec form (TP-274-V) and the corresponding federal form (T2091 or T1255), you must send a copy of both forms to Revenu Québec along with supporting documents to justify the difference.

,
designate the period(s) and/or year(s) that this property was your principal residence.
Designate a period or periods from 1971 to 1981: (e.g. from 1975 to 1981)

InputField.ErrorMessage: There must be at least one entry for the years. The year should at least be 1972. Year must be 4 digits.

Note.Blurb: Designate a period or periods from 1982 on: (e.g. from 1999 to 2013)

InputField.ErrorMessage: There must be at least one entry for the years. The year should at least be 1972.Year must be 4 digits.

Note.Blurb: Designate the year of the creation of the real servitude on the property (if applicable): (e.g. 2005)

,
do you agree to the following terms:
1. I designate this property as my principal residence for which it was in my possession, at the exclusion of other properties, for the years indicated above.

2. I declare that I did not designate any other property as my principal residence and that, for each year that is after 1981 or for the year of the creation of the real servitude on the property, no other property had been designated as residence by any of the following persons:
my spouse (unless the spouse was separated from me for the entire year because of a judicial decree or a written separation agreement);
my child, if, during the year, he/she was under 18 years of age and he/she had no spouse;

my father, mother, brother or sister (where the latter two had no spouse and were under 18 years of age during the year), while I, myself, was spouseless and was less than 18 years of age during the year
3. I declare the information provided on the TP-274 (Designation of Property as Principal Residence) is accurate and complete.
